Cmd.CmdDesc: Get the ID and size of each defined NV data set.

Parm.ParmDefaultValue: AA AA AA AA AA AA AA AA

Cmd.CmdDesc: Writes NumberOfBytes bytes from Data array, starting from StartAddress. In case StartAddress is in flash, 0 bytes are written.

Parm.ParmDesc: Start address for write operation. For HCS08 platforms, only the last two bytes from the address parameter are used.(e.g. 0x00001000 represent address 0x1000).
Number of bytes to be written in memory
Data to be written in memory

Cmd.CmdDesc: Reads NumberOfBytes bytes from memory, starting from StartAddress.

Parm.ParmDesc: Start address for read operation. For HCS08 platforms, only the last two bytes from the address parameter are used.(e.g. 0x00001000 represent address 0x1000).
Number of bytes to be read from memory

Write physical address or GPIO address

Cmd.CmdDesc: Request a minimal set of information about the image. A value of 0xFFs has a special meaning of a wild card. The value has a 'match all' effect on the PC App

Cmd.CmdDesc: Obtain a minimal set of information about the image

Parm.ParmDesc: Device ID (short address - in almost all cases)

Cmd.CmdDesc: Test if the image is already in the external memory or can be used (store image in the external memory or/and notify over the air - dongle solution-).

Parm.ParmDesc: Device ID (short address - in almost all cases)

Cmd.CmdDesc: Receive a block of Image from PC Application
Terminate the upgrade process (error occurred or download process was stoped)
Request a block of OTA Image to the PC Application

Parm.ParmDesc: Device ID (short address - in almost all cases)
